description: Measures the novelty, originality, and boldness of the idea. Assesses how effectively AI is applied to solve the chosen problem in a way that goes beyond existing methods. Key Questions: Is this solution conceptually new or a creative improvement? Does it leverage AI tools (LLMs, ML, vision, speech, automation) in an unconventional or powerful way? Does it demonstrate out-of-the-box thinking or a "10× mindset"? Scoring: 0-3: Minimal innovation or replication. 4-6: Moderate creativity, standard AI usage. 7-8: Strong novelty and clever integration. 9-10: Disruptive, breakthrough idea with global scalability.

Evaluates how well the solution is built — including system architecture, coding quality, data use, and technical reliability. Key Questions: Is the prototype functional and stable? Are the AI/ML models implemented effectively and ethically? Does the solution show understanding of data pipelines, APIs, or integration? Are code and architecture documented and reproducible? Scoring: 0-3: Poor technical execution, concept only. 4-6: Basic functionality, limited AI integration. 7-8: Robust technical build, thoughtful engineering. 9-10: Advanced architecture, optimized model, and seamless user experience.

Assesses how realistically the solution can grow from a pilot to large-scale deployment across Bangladesh and globally. Key Questions: Can this solution work beyond one region or pilot phase? Are infrastructure, cost, and user adoption challenges considered? Does the design allow modularity, API integration, or open-source replication? Are sustainability and maintenance plans included? Scoring: 0-3: Limited to a prototype or concept stage. 4-6: Feasible locally but limited scaling strategy. 7-8: Scalable with clear roadmap and technical readiness. 9-10: Fully scalable, globally replicable, and sustainable.

Measures the project's relevance to national priorities, SDGs, and human development. Focuses on measurable benefits for people, communities, and industries. Key Questions: Does this solution address a real problem affecting Bangladesh's population or economy? Are the potential benefits quantifiable (e.g., improved learning outcomes, reduced costs, increased income, reduced mortality)? Does it align with SDGs or national digital transformation goals? Does it include equity, accessibility, and gender inclusion considerations? Scoring: 0-3: Limited or unclear social impact. 4-6: Localized or small-scale benefits. 7-8: Strong national relevance with measurable outcomes. 9-10: Transformational impact, high social ROI, and inclusive reach.

Evaluates how clearly the idea, value, and impact are communicated. Judges the narrative, visuals, and delivery effectiveness of the team. Key Questions: Is the problem and solution clearly articulated? Does the story engage and inspire (why it matters, who benefits)? Are visuals, demos, or UI intuitive and compelling? Does the presentation connect logic, emotion, and purpose effectively? Scoring: 0-3: Unclear explanation, poor visuals or delivery. 4-6: Adequate communication, some clarity gaps. 7-8: Strong, well-structured storytelling with visuals. 9-10: Inspiring, data-driven, memorable — pitch-ready for global investors.
